alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:19PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yellowstone County through 215 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Lockwood, or 10 miles southeast of Billings, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Lockwood, Billings Heights and Billings West End. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
